title: Gallery Talk: Casting Modernity through the Human Figure
hero_caption: Auguste Rodin. The Fallen Caryatid Carrying Her Stone, modeled 1881–82, cast 1902/24. Gift of Robert Allerton.
short_description: In their quest for modernity, artists challenged the representation of the ideal human figure. Emotions overshadowed anatomical preoccupations, and the pedestal took different forms and, at times, completely disappeared. Join educator Giannella Ysasi to explore the ways in which sculpture investigates the expressive potential of the human figure.
description:
In their quest for modernity, artists challenged the representation of the ideal human figure. Emotions overshadowed anatomical preoccupations, and the pedestal took different forms and, at times, completely disappeared. Join educator Giannella Ysasi to explore the ways in which sculpture investigates the expressive potential of the human figure. 

Please note that the artwork on this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.
